org.jcatapult.config
Class EnvironmentAwareConfiguration

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.commons.configuration.event.EventSource
      org.apache.commons.configuration.AbstractConfiguration
          org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration
              org.jcatapult.config.EnvironmentAwareConfiguration
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, org.apache.commons.configuration.Configuration
public class EnvironmentAwareConfiguration
extends org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration

This class is an Apache configuration that is environment aware. In order to set this up to work correctly, there needs to be a method for resolving the environment. Usually this is handled via a JNDI entry, because it is simplest. In fact, the default resolver uses this method, so unless you need to override that behavior, you should be fine. If you need something more specific, you'll need to implement the EnvironmentResolver interface.

This class loads up configuration using a simple hierarchical system. The default configuration is loaded first. This configuration file is named config-default.xml. Then the environment specific configuration is loaded next using the environment resolver. The name of the environment is then appended to the file name to find the environment configuration file like this: 

 config-<environment>.xml

This file is then loaded, which means that the configuration in that file takes precendence.

The location of the configuration is specified using the JCatapult property jcatapult.config.location.

However, if the application is stored in a WAR, than the configuration is loaded via the classpath using the prefix: 

 /config

Constructor Detail

EnvironmentAwareConfiguration

public EnvironmentAwareConfiguration(EnvironmentResolver environmentResolver,
                                     ContainerResolver resolver,
                                     String location)
                              throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
Constructs a new configuration.

Parameters:
environmentResolver - The environment resolver to use for loading the configuration.
resolver - The path resolver used to find the configuration files.
location - The location of the configuration files.
Throws:
org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException - If the configuration could not be loaded.
